page.title: 06St.Michael's Church
page.content: Although there is a fairly small population in this area,there are 6 places of Worship{Religion}is not as important as it once was,but is still fairly well supported. {St.Michael's}at the top of Ramsey hill overlooks the valley,and there has been a church on this sight since Saxon times.The original was a wooden structure,rebuilt in stone by the Normans,and part of this remains today.Visitors might also look for the 16th C pulpit,15th C font,and pre civil war Royal arms. There are 2{Methodist}chapels in the area,and the most recent is next to the mill footpath in Ramsey,this has 13 members.The chapel in{Little Oakley was built as recently as 1969,even though it only has 15 members.The minister of both{Rev Lemmon}looks after 5 others;people are friendly.
